Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.0312 inches in the direction of the normal. **Construct part 2: Three cylinders of varying heights and diameters, arranged in a triangular formation** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of [0.0402, 0.0402, 0.0312]. This face contains a single loop with one circle. Create the third face of the sketch, which is another circle. 1. Draw circle 3 with a center at point [0.6598, 0.0098] and a radius of 0.0098 inches. This face contains a single loop with one circle. Create the fourth face of the sketch, which is another circle. 1. Draw circle 4 with a center at point [0.6598, 0.6598] and a radius of 0.0098 inches. This face contains a single loop with one circle. Now, define the coordinate system for extruding the sketch. Set the Euler angles to [0, 0, 0] and the translation vector to [0, 0, 0.25]. Extrude each face in the opposite direction of the normal by a depth of 0.25 inches. When extruding, use the "cut" operation to remove material. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and three circular cutouts arranged in a triangular formation. The prism has sharp edges and a smooth surface. The cutouts are slightly tapered, narrowing towards the top. The prism has a length and width of approximately 0.75 inches, a height of approximately 0.25 inches (excluding the height of the circular cutouts), and a total height including the circular cutouts of approximately 0.5 inches.</description>
